intro: Stigmatodon euclidianus, commonly known as the African orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has a terrestrial growth habit and produces pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb moisture from the surrounding soil. Stigmatodon euclidianus is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest undergrowth.
